alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Lexington; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 6:29PM EDT until July 06 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken, Lexington and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wagener, Springfield, Salley, Perry and Perry Airport. - Streams that will rise quickly are; Ritter Branch, Hollow Creek, and areas along the N. Fork of the Edisto River northeast and east of Wagener. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
